intro: Vermeulenia papilionacea var. cyrenaica, commonly known as the Cyrenaica broom, is a flowering plant native to North Africa and the Middle East. It is a shrub characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, demonstrating adaptability to harsh, dry conditions. Its leaves are typically narrow and linear, reducing water loss through transpiration. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine in some regions.
